Package org.eclipse.mosaic.fed.application.ambassador.simulation

Class VehicleUnit

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.mosaic.fed.application.ambassador.simulation.AbstractSimulationUnit
      • org.eclipse.mosaic.fed.application.ambassador.simulation.VehicleUnit
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    INavigationModuleOwner, CommunicationModuleOwner, PerceptionModuleOwner, OperatingSystem, VehicleOperatingSystem, EventProcessor
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ElectricVehicleUnit
    public class VehicleUnit
extends AbstractSimulationUnit
implements VehicleOperatingSystem
    This class represents a vehicle in the application simulator.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      VehicleUnit​(String vehicleName, VehicleType vehicleType, GeoPoint initialPosition)
      Creates a vehicle simulation unit.

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void activateVehicleSensors​(double sensorRange, VehicleSensorActivation.SensorType... sensorTypes)
      Activates the detection of the leading vehicle within in a given distance.

      Applies vehicle parameter changes which are defined in {@param vehicleParametersRequest}.
      CamBuilder assembleCamMessage​(CamBuilder camBuilder)
      Assembles a CamBuilder (Cooperative Awareness Message) using the given MessageRouting and the units' status information.
      void changeLane​(int targetLaneIndex, long duration)
      Forces a lane change to the lane with the given index; If successful, the lane will be chosen for the given amount of time.

      Forces a lane change to the lane according to the specified mode; If successful, the lane will be chosen for the given amount of time.

      Allows control over the vehicle speed and the acceleration.

      Returns the type of the vehicle.
      INavigationModule getNavigationModule()
      Returns the navigation module of the vehicle.
      PerceptionModule<SimplePerceptionConfiguration> getPerceptionModule()
      Returns the perception module of this unit.
      GeoPoint getPosition()
      This data element provides an absolute geographical longitude and latitude in a WGS84 coordinate system with a granularity of 1/8 micro degrees.
      IRoadPosition getRoadPosition()
      Returns the road position of the vehicle containing all information about the vehicle's position within the road network, such as previous and upcoming node or the way the vehicle is currently driving on.
      VehicleData getVehicleData()
      Returns the current vehicle data state.
      VehicleParameters getVehicleParameters()
      Returns vehicle parameters.

      Returns a request object, which can be used to change vehicle parameters.
      void resetSpeed()
      Resets the speed of the vehicle to car-following rules after the speed has been set with VehicleOperatingSystem.changeSpeedWithInterval(double, long).
      void resume()
      Resumes a previously stopped vehicle.
      void slowDown​(float speed, long duration)
      Slow down the vehicle with the given Id to the given speed until the given time (the vehicle is not guaranteed to have the given speed at the end of the given time).

      • changeLane

        public void changeLane​(VehicleLaneChange.VehicleLaneChangeMode vehicleLaneChangeMode,
                       long duration)
        Description copied from interface: VehicleOperatingSystem
        Forces a lane change to the lane according to the specified mode; If successful, the lane will be chosen for the given amount of time.

        Note: use changeLane(), for mode VehicleLaneChangeMode.index.
        Specified by:
        changeLane in interface VehicleOperatingSystem
        Parameters:
        vehicleLaneChangeMode - mode to change lane
        duration - the duration for the lane change in nanoseconds

      • slowDown

        public void slowDown​(float speed,
                     long duration)
        Description copied from interface: VehicleOperatingSystem
        Slow down the vehicle with the given Id to the given speed until the given time (the vehicle is not guaranteed to have the given speed at the end of the given time). With this command it is possible to simulate e.g., instant brakes, slowing down, etc.
        Specified by:
        slowDown in interface VehicleOperatingSystem
        Parameters:
        speed - new speed
        duration - Time interval for which the slow down should be valid, after that interval the vehicle will accelerate again. Unit: [ns].

        Specified by:

        Parameters:

        interval - the new speed should be reached in [ns]

                    long durationInNs)
        Description copied from interface: VehicleOperatingSystem

        Parameters:

      • requestVehicleParametersUpdate

        public VehicleParameters.VehicleParametersChangeRequest requestVehicleParametersUpdate()
        Description copied from interface: VehicleOperatingSystem
        Returns a request object, which can be used to change vehicle parameters. After changing relevant parameters, this request object must be passed to VehicleOperatingSystem.applyVehicleParametersChange(VehicleParameters.VehicleParametersChangeRequest) in order to apply the vehicle parameters.
        Specified by:
        requestVehicleParametersUpdate in interface VehicleOperatingSystem
        Returns:
        an request object, which can be used to change vehicle parameters.
